description.narrative: By end 2021, state actors and civil society have up-to-date descriptive and analytical information (qualitative and quantitative) on vulnerability and the different forms of disparity (socio-economic, gender, geographical), which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Environmental Sustainability, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: By the end of 2021, the Government makes better use of knowledge about the situation of children, especially the most disadvantaged, in decision-making and implements inclusive development policies and strategies with youth and adolescents' participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, state actors and civil society have up-to-date descriptive and analytical information (qualitative and quantitative) on vulnerability and the different forms of disparity (socio-economic, gender, geographical)

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the capacity development of government actors and of the national statistics system, including through provision of technical assistance for the MICS6 survey, for which data collection was considerably delayed and only finalized at the end of 2019. In the absence of new socio-demographic data, a compilation of existing data and preliminary findings from studies and two programmatic evaluations (child protection and education) informed the situation analysis of children in Chad and the Mid-Term Review of the country programme. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020
